forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 54. West southwest wind 8 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph.

forecast.name: Sunday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 65, with temperatures falling to around 63 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 7 to 16 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph.

weather_report:
This evening in Downtown San Francisco, the skies are adorned with a playful tapestry of clouds, creating a gentle contrast against the fading light. The air is crisp, tinged with the coolness that nudges the temperatures down to a cozy 54 degrees. A subtle west southwest wind weaves through the streets, rustling the leaves and lending a whispering energy to the ambiance. As for fog, it lingers just off the shore, cloaking the Golden Gate Bridge and occasionally drifting into the bay, reminding passersby of the city's mercurial nature.

Tomorrow promises a more cheerful disposition, with mostly sunny outlooks as the sun climbs to a high of 65, before softening into the afternoon's embrace at around 63. The wind will continue its playful dance, becoming a partner in warmth at 7 to 16 mph, occasionally gusting up to 22 mph. Given the pleasantness of the forecast, an afternoon stroll along the waterfront or a leisurely visit to one of the city's vibrant markets would make for a delightful way to spend the day. Dress in layers; a light jacket would keep you snug as the marine layer retreats. Let the cool evening air guide you into the night, where the twinkling lights of the city breathe life into the softly obscured views ahead.
